text: The 2004 Fed Cup was the 42nd edition of the most important competition between national teams in women's tennis. The final was held at the Ice Palace Krylatskoye in Moscow, Russia, on 27–28 November. The home team Russia defeated the defending champion France to win their first title after five final appearances. ==World Group== {| class="wikitable" style="width:100%;" |- !colspan=4|Participating Teams |- !style="width:25%;"| !style="width:25%;"| !style="width:25%;"| !style="width:25%;"| |- ! ! ! ! |- ! ! ! ! |- ! ! ! ! |} ===Draw=== ==World Group Play-offs== Date: 10–11 July The eight losing teams in the World Group first round ties and eight winners of the Zonal Group I sections competed in the World Group Play-offs for spots in the 2005 World Group II. {| class=wikitable style="border:1px solid #AAAAAA;" |- !
